content:
• Thursday, December 29, 2011
  • ASTX

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +6%) finishes higher today after announcing the FDA will be holding...

    Astex Pharmaceuticals (ASTX +6%) finishes higher today after announcing the FDA will be holding a meeting to discuss its supplemental new drug application for Dacogen, an injection for the treatment of elderly acute myelogenous leukemia.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM
  • MEIP

    Marshall Edwards (MSHL +1.9%) finishes the day higher after saying earlier it expects to close...

    Marshall Edwards (MSHL +1.9%) finishes the day higher after saying earlier it expects to close tomorrow on $2M in gross proceeds from the sale of 1.94M shares of its stock in a private placement with Novogen Limited (NVGN +9.8%), its largest individual shareholder.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM

  • Lake Shore Gold (LSG +6.4%) pops after saying a technical report containing estimates for its...

    Lake Shore Gold (LSG +6.4%) pops after saying a technical report containing estimates for its Thunder Creek property says the resource contains over 521K ounces of gold.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • CTIC

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +10.9%) rallies after the FDA says the company's drug pixantrone, which...

    Cell Therapeutics (CTIC +10.9%) rallies after the FDA says the company's drug pixantrone, which is under review for adults with non-Hodgkin's lymphoma, will be discussed by an advisory committee in early February.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM
  • HOLI

    Roth Capital raises its rating on Hollysys Automation (HOLI +19%) to Buy from Hold, with a $10...

    Roth Capital raises its rating on Hollysys Automation (HOLI +19%) to Buy from Hold, with a $10 price target, in the wake of yesterday's report on July's fatal Chinese bullet train collision. The conclusions about the incident did not identify HOLI's systems as problematic, which Roth says removes "an overhang" and means contract activity should resume next quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:26 PM
  • GENTY

    Gentium (GENT -4.3%) trades lower today after saying it expects to submit answers for its lead...

    Gentium (GENT -4.3%) trades lower today after saying it expects to submit answers for its lead product candidate Defibrotide to European regulators during Q1 of 2012. The drug is used to treat and prevent hepatic veno-occlusive disease in adults and children undergoing haematopoietic stem-cell transplantation therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM
  • NWSA

    News Corp. (NWSA +1.9%) advances after RBC upgrades the stock to Top Pick, saying it offers the...

    News Corp. (NWSA +1.9%) advances after RBC upgrades the stock to Top Pick, saying it offers the best combination among big media firms of "operating momentum, return of capital potential, company-specific catalysts and reasonable valuation" in 2012. RBC cites the potential of $15B in dividends and stock buybacks, ratings growth at FX and a syndication deal if The Simpsons ends its long run.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM
  • BDSI

    Microcap BioDelivery Sciences (BDSI +21.1%) soars after the firm lands FDA approval for a risk...

    Microcap BioDelivery Sciences (BDSI +21.1%) soars after the firm lands FDA approval for a risk strategy covering all transmucosal fentanyl products for pain management.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM
  • MMC

    Other homebuilding suppliers getting a boost from today's encouraging pending home sales data:...

    Other homebuilding suppliers getting a boost from today's encouraging pending home sales data: Martin Marietta Materials (MMC +2.1%), Vulcan Materials (VMC +1.2%), Masco (MAS +6.9%), Texas Insustries (TXI +3.8%) and CRH (CRH +2.2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 3:02 PM
  • MDT

    Medtronic (MDT +2.6%) moves higher after Citigroup chooses the company as its top pick among...

    Medtronic (MDT +2.6%) moves higher after Citigroup chooses the company as its top pick among medical device companies for 2012 and hikes its price target to $44 from $40. Citi believes MDT’s lagging ICD and spinal hardware segments should rebound in 2012, and new gadgets, including pacemakers, should help boost growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • ARO

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO +1.8%) are higher today, despite an earlier bearish call from...

    Shares of Aeropostale (ARO +1.8%) are higher today, despite an earlier bearish call from Citigroup analyst Jeff Black. Black says the teen retailer's Q4 results may come up short along with many of its peers. He notes the company's sales are in "tough shape" with promotions ranging around 60%, the highest he's seen this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:26 PM
  • XCO

    Exco Resources (XCO +4.1%) is among the session's top gainers after owner Wilbur Ross is...

    Exco Resources (XCO +4.1%) is among the session's top gainers after owner Wilbur Ross is revealed to have bought 848,200 shares worth more than $8.2M.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:13 PM
  • HSBC

    HSBC (HBC +0.8%) says it's renewed its private label credit card agreement with Saks (SKS...

    HSBC (HBC +0.8%) says it's renewed its private label credit card agreement with Saks (SKS +1.3%), Darvin Furniture, Big Lots (BIG +1.1%) and Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK.A -0.1%) Jordan's Furniture. The renewals bode well for Capital One (COF +1.3%), which is buying the bank's U.S. card business and runs the risk of losing some of its partners.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • MFRM

    Mattress Firm (MFRM +1.3%) gets a bump after William Blair initiates coverage with an Outperform...

    Mattress Firm (MFRM +1.3%) gets a bump after William Blair initiates coverage with an Outperform rating, saying the company has levered itself to take advantage of growing demand for specialty mattresses.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:17 PM
  • BAYRY

    Bayer AG (OTCPK:BAYRY +3%) moves higher after announcing its partner Janssen Research &...

    Bayer AG (OTCPK:BAYRY +3%) moves higher after announcing its partner Janssen Research & Development has submitted a supplemental new drug application to the FDA for its oral anticoagulant Xarelto, also known as rivaroxaban, in combination with standard antiplatelet therapy to reduce the risk of cardiovascular events in patients with acute coronary syndrome.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM
  • RTI

    Rare earths (REMX +0.8%) attempt a rebound from a two-day slide after China said it was cutting...

    Rare earths (REMX +0.8%) attempt a rebound from a two-day slide after China said it was cutting rare earth export quotas. Credit Suisse now says alterations in the way the figures were reported might’ve made changes seem severe, and forecasts China’s full-year 2012 rare earth exports to rise ~3%, in-line with previous expectations. RTI +2.2% and TC +0.9%, but MCP -2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM | 2 Comments
  • CDMO

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +5%) jump after the developer of antibodies to treat...

    Shares of Peregrine Pharmaceuticals (PPHM +5%) jump after the developer of antibodies to treat cancer and viral infections says preliminary phase II trial results for its bavituximab drug to treat patients with hepatitis C showed antiviral activity and that the treatment is safe.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • EBS

    Emergent BioSolutions (EBS +4%) moves up after Caris & Co. initiates the stock with a Buy,...

    Emergent BioSolutions (EBS +4%) moves up after Caris & Co. initiates the stock with a Buy, apparently unfazed by Abbott's decision yesterday to end its venture on TRU-016 with the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND +9.5%) spikes as SunTrust's Bill Chappell tells CNBC that short sellers -...

    Diamond Foods (DMND +9.5%) spikes as SunTrust's Bill Chappell tells CNBC that short sellers - who hold 45% of the company's float - could be spooked if accounting issues get resolved by mid-February and DMND comes out relatively clean. Shares had jumped earlier this week on a rumor that David Einhorn had acquired a stake, which Chappell says would be a "catalyst."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM
  • ACTV

    Active Network (ACTV +2.7%) gets a boost this morning after ThinkEquity initiates the stock with...

    Active Network (ACTV +2.7%) gets a boost this morning after ThinkEquity initiates the stock with a Buy on valuation. The stock is down over 35% since July and appears to have stablilized at current levels, offering an attractive entry point to begin accumulating shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • HIL

    Hill International (HIL +3%) says it's landed a 3.3M contract from the Iraqi Ministry of Youth...

    Hill International (HIL +3%) says it's landed a 3.3M contract from the Iraqi Ministry of Youth and Sports to manage the construction of Al Anbar Olympic Stadium in Al Anbar, Iraq. The stadium is expected to have a total construction cost of around $100M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • SMRT

    Stein Mart (SMRT +1.8%) gains after saying Nasdaq has notified the company that it's back in...

    Stein Mart (SMRT +1.8%) gains after saying Nasdaq has notified the company that it's back in compliance with listing rules after filing its third-quarter Form 10-Q late last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:45 AM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers (DECK -5.4%) fall on increased chatter that a negative report is due to be...

    Shares of Deckers (DECK -5.4%) fall on increased chatter that a negative report is due to be issued on the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • T

    J.P. Morgan views Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.4%) and MetroPCS (PCS +2.6%) as potential takeover...

    J.P. Morgan views Leap Wireless (LEAP +3.4%) and MetroPCS (PCS +2.6%) as potential takeover targets amid speculation on where AT&T and T-Mobile could go for more spectrum following the collapse of their planned merger. Speculation has centered on Dish Networks and Clearwire, but JPM believes a deal for LEAP or PCS should pass regulatory scrutiny.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • DXCM

    DexCom (DXCM +3.4%) gets a boost after Wunderlich initiates coverage with a Buy, saying that...

    DexCom (DXCM +3.4%) gets a boost after Wunderlich initiates coverage with a Buy, saying that growing visibility on the company's Gen4 approval process should push the stock near, or possibly through its $12 price target over the next 12 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:32 AM
  • DHI

    Homebuilders (XHB +1.6%) pop on the surprisingly strong jump in pending home sales: DHI +2.8%,...

    Homebuilders (XHB +1.6%) pop on the surprisingly strong jump in pending home sales: DHI +2.8%, PHM +4.2%, MDC +2.8%, RYL +2.6%, KBH +3.1%, BZH +3.5%, HOV +4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • MOS

    Mosaic (MOS -2.3%) shares slide following yesterday's announced curtailment of phosphate...

    Mosaic (MOS -2.3%) shares slide following yesterday's announced curtailment of phosphate production due to oversupply and pricing. Other ag stocks that may see volatility on the news are holding up reasonably well so far: POT -0.6%, AGU -0.5%, CF +0.2%, IPI -0.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) proclaims 2011 "the best holiday ever for the Kindle family," with sales of...

    Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) proclaims 2011 "the best holiday ever for the Kindle family," with sales of more than 1M of the devices/week throughout December, led by the new "Fire." The company also notes the success of its Direct Publishing program, with the #1 and #4 best-sellers on Kindle both published independently by their authors. Shares -2.7% premarket as Heather Bellini warns on the company's Q4 revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM
  • ARMH

    Premarket gainers: ARMH +1%. YHOO +1%. SNE +1%. BHP +1%.Losers: MOS -3%. ING -3%. AMZN -2%.

    Premarket gainers: ARMH +1%. YHOO +1%. SNE +1%. BHP +1%.
    Losers: MOS -3%. ING -3%. AMZN -2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • UTX

    Shares of United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) slip 1.3% in premarket action after Argus Research...

    Shares of United Technologies (NYSE:UTX) slip 1.3% in premarket action after Argus Research takes its rating down a notch to Hold from Buy. Analysts with the firm cite "mixed" prospects for UTX in 2012 with higher commodity prices, steeper developments costs, and pension pressure all sitting as overhangs.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:02 AM
  • OPXT

    Opnext (NASDAQ:OPXT) says it relocated production out of Thailand to manufacturing facilities in...

    Opnext (NASDAQ:OPXT) says it relocated production out of Thailand to manufacturing facilities in Japan and California as one of its main contract manufacturers remains down due to flooding damage. The firm warns that the loss of production capacity will have a "significant impact" on its operations and ability to meet customer demand for the remainder of FY11. Shares -2.8% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:36 AM

  • Gold continues its late-year slide, off 2.4% to $1,526/oz., the lowest price since early July....

    Gold continues its late-year slide, off 2.4% to $1,526/oz., the lowest price since early July. Off 3.6% to $26.28, silver has returned to its low for the year.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 AM

  • The euro returns to its lows of the year, sinking below $1.29 for the first time since the early...

    The euro returns to its lows of the year, sinking below $1.29 for the first time since the early days of January. Declines earlier this fall seemed to be correlated with risk - as European shares went, so went the euro. Of late, the euro's slide seems more about the realization that the ECB is papering the continent with them. Euro -0.5% and buying $1.2880.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:53 AM
